values.description:
See issue #9.

The idea of this pull request is to use a new environment variable `IGN_RELAY` to bridge two or more networks and being able to send/receive discovery messages.

The best way to test it is to generate the documentation and follow the new tutorial.
values.title: Relay

summary.raw:
See issue #9.

The idea of this pull request is to use a new environment variable `IGN_RELAY` to bridge two or more networks and being able to send/receive discovery messages.

The best way to test it is to generate the documentation and follow the new tutorial.
summary.html:
See issue #9.

The idea of this pull request is to use a new environment variable IGN_RELAY to bridge two or more networks and being able to send/receive discovery messages.

The best way to test it is to generate the documentation and follow the new tutorial.

values.description: The cmake code for generating the `cmd*.rb` and `*.yaml` files used by the `ign` tool is duplicated across many projects with the project name hard-coded. This PR uses `IGN_DESIGNATION` to generalize this code a bit to make it easier to keep each package using the same code. The best would be to port it to ign-cmake, but this will do for now.
values.title: generalize cmake code for ign tool command and yaml files

summary.raw: The cmake code for generating the `cmd*.rb` and `*.yaml` files used by the `ign` tool is duplicated across many projects with the project name hard-coded. This PR uses `IGN_DESIGNATION` to generalize this code a bit to make it easier to keep each package using the same code. The best would be to port it to ign-cmake, but this will do for now.
summary.html: The cmake code for generating the cmd*.rb and *.yaml files used by the ign tool is duplicated across many projects with the project name hard-coded. This PR uses IGN_DESIGNATION to generalize this code a bit to make it easier to keep each package using the same code. The best would be to port it to ign-cmake, but this will do for now.

values.description:
We are experiencing occasional issues on Homebrew with a test that is just:

```
ignition::transport::Node node;
```

Under some circumstances, the `Node` destructor can be executed before the \`NodeShared::PublishThread\` is in `wait()`. In this situation, the destructor calls `notify_all` but the \`NodeShared::PublishThread\` misses the notification and never wakes up.

The patch in this PR:

* Wakes up the condition variable in any case every 500 ms. as a backup plan in case the notification was missed.
* Additionally, the condition variable wasn’t using a boolean predicate, so it was subject to spurious weakups. It should be fixed now.

I left the example runnning in a loop for a few ~~hours~~ days and I didn’t experience the problem anymore :fingers_crossed:
values.title: [Blueprint] Fix fast constructor-destructor issue

summary.raw:
We are experiencing occasional issues on Homebrew with a test that is just:

```
ignition::transport::Node node;
```

Under some circumstances, the `Node` destructor can be executed before the \`NodeShared::PublishThread\` is in `wait()`. In this situation, the destructor calls `notify_all` but the \`NodeShared::PublishThread\` misses the notification and never wakes up.

The patch in this PR:

* Wakes up the condition variable in any case every 500 ms. as a backup plan in case the notification was missed.
* Additionally, the condition variable wasn’t using a boolean predicate, so it was subject to spurious weakups. It should be fixed now.

I left the example runnning in a loop for a few ~~hours~~ days and I didn’t experience the problem anymore :fingers_crossed:
summary.html:
We are experiencing occasional issues on Homebrew with a test that is just:

ignition::transport::Node node;

Under some circumstances, the Node destructor can be executed before the `NodeShared::PublishThread` is in wait(). In this situation, the destructor calls notify_all but the `NodeShared::PublishThread` misses the notification and never wakes up.

The patch in this PR:

  • Wakes up the condition variable in any case every 500 ms. as a backup plan in case the notification was missed.
  • Additionally, the condition variable wasn’t using a boolean predicate, so it was subject to spurious weakups. It should be fixed now.

I left the example runnning in a loop for a few hours days and I didn’t experience the problem anymore

values.description: It's possible for a log file to become corrupt. Without this fix, a corrupt log file will fail to play. This fix allows the log file to play up to the corrupt line.
values.title: [SubT] Handle corrupt log file
